---

```{r}
library(p5)

p5() %>%
  createCanvas(100, 100) %>%
  background("#002d72") %>%
  rect(x = 10, y = 10, w = 50, h = 50)
```

---

```{r}
library(p5)
library(tibble)

squares <- data_frame(x = c(100, 100, 200, 200),
                      y = c(50, 150, 50, 150),
                      w = rep(40, 4),
                      h = rep(40, 4))

squares %>%
  p5() %>%
  createCanvas(300, 200) %>%
  background("#002d72") %>%
  rect()
```

---

```{r}
p5() %>%
  createCanvas(100, 100) %>%
  background("#DCDCDC") %>%
  arc(50, 55, 50, 50, 0, ~HALF_PI) %>%
  noFill() %>%
  arc(50, 55, 60, 60, ~HALF_PI, ~PI) %>%
  arc(50, 55, 70, 70, ~PI, ~PI+QUARTER_PI) %>%
  arc(50, 55, 80, 80, ~PI+QUARTER_PI, ~TWO_PI)
```

---

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(tibble)

stripes <- data_frame(
  x = rep(0, 7),
  y = cumsum(c(0, rep(30, 6))),
  w = rep(190*2, 7),
  h = rep(15, 7)
)

stripes_ <- stripes %>%
  p5() %>%
  createCanvas(190*2, 200) %>%
  fill("#B22234") %>%
  noStroke() %>%
  rect()

stars_ <- p5() %>%
  fill("#3C3B6E") %>%
  noStroke() %>%
  rect(0, 0, 152, 105)

bind_sketches(stripes_, stars_)
```

---

```{r}
draw() %>%
  background("#F4F8FC") %>%
  line(~mouseX, 0, ~mouseX, 200) %>%
  sketch(draw = .)
```

---

```{r}
p5() %>%
  createCanvas(400, 300) %>%
  background("#F4F8FC") %>%
  ellipse(~mouseX, ~mouseY, 30, 30)
```

---

```{r}
setup_ <- setup() %>%
  createCanvas(640, 480)
draw_ <- draw() %>%
  js("
      if (mouseIsPressed) {
        fill(0);
      } else {
        fill(255);
      }
  ") %>%
  ellipse(~mouseX, ~mouseY, 80, 80)
sketch(setup = setup_, draw = draw_)
```

# Goals:

1. Make it easier to create interactive models in R.
2. Create a bridge for R programers to learn Javascript.
